title: List highlight filter: Toggle to highlight/step only on in same folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
List highlight filter (I hope I correctly name this feature) is awesome feature that I have been waiting for! Thank you! ðŸ™Œ 

Currently it navigates user across all visible folders/files that has fuzzy match.
In case when I want to find some folder inside of long `node_modules` I will be still navigated through all visible filse/folders.

So if I'm typing `lo` inside of `node_modules` (when folder inside of `node_modules` highlighted) I will still have match on `package-lock.json`, `yarn.lock`, and `src/locales`.

Would be nice to have ability to limit match only inside parent folder(node).
So when I have `axios` folder selected inside `node_modules` and type `lo` - it will only highglight `babel-loader`, `lodash`, and `loglevel` package folders, but **not** `package-lock.json`, `yarn.lock`, and `src/locales`.

It might be added to List filter widget, same panel as "Filter on type" toggle.

title: Improve CLI startup performance
body:
It's been reported that starting VS Code via our CLI adds a significant delay to our startup performance. https://mobile.twitter.com/Snugug/status/1086289295088988161

A quick test on my Macbook Pro 13" 2018:
```
time code .
code .  0.17s user 0.14s system 48% cpu 0.641 total

time open "/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app"
open "/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app"  0.02s user 0.03s system 12% cpu 0.433 total
```

title: SnippetString choices are prefixed with typed text instead of replacing
body:
If you use a choice in a snippet string like this:

```ts
const ss = new vs.SnippetString("${1|one,two,three|} = xxx");
await editor.insertSnippet(ss, new vs.Range(document.positionAt(startPos), document.positionAt(endPos)));
```

It appears like this:

![screenshot 2019-01-21 at 12 19 59 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1078012/51474348-e3667580-1d76-11e9-9f3f-028d97f2d931.png)

The cursor is before the text, which means if I start typing I get this (`one` remains after where I'm typing):

![screenshot 2019-01-21 at 12 20 42 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1078012/51474384-fd07bd00-1d76-11e9-9f28-5f8a34d2fce6.png)

It does correctly delete the whole lot when you select one, but it looks really wonky and if you want to type a value that's not in the choice list, you end up having to delete the pre-inserted text afterwards.

I think the snippet should be selected and over-typed if I start typing.

title: Is there an event like preClose for web view?
body: I created an extension, it will create some web views, I wonder is there an event like preCloseWebView? Because I have to check the data in the web views is legal or not. The web view cannot be closed if any data is illegal.  Much appreciate if any help.

title: Windows uninstaller should have option to also remove user data dir and extensions dir

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I tried to uninstall / Reinstall `Code Insider` because of a recurring Error/Crash at "startup/reloaded" (Update / Reboot / proper exit), disabling extensions and remove all custom settings did not fixed it
Before re-installing i wanted to be sure i has no crap left that code have hurted `Code Insiders` .... surprise surprise ....

- VSCode Version: Latest of `Code` and `Code Insider`
- OS Version: `Windows 10`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install it
2. Add extensions
3. Change settings
4. Use it
5. Update it
6. Uninstall it
7. Be curious on what's left

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2266487/51462007-dd18cf00-1d5f-11e9-80ac-51fd683e7752.png)


On top of that, i uninstalled extensions long time ago and they were still on disk, here is what `code-insiders --list-extensions` output :

```
Angular.ng-template
bierner.markdown-preview-github-styles
eamodio.gitlens
EditorConfig.EditorConfig
eg2.tslint

GitHub.vscode-pull-request-github
```

title: VS Code holds onto parent console when launched via command line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Repro:

1. Open cmd.exe
2. Run `code`
3. Switch back to cmd.exe
4. `exit`

Repro's in stable and insiderrs and does not repro in Atom which is also on Electron 2.

Advice from Windows console team:

> I believe VSCode is reconnecting to its parent hosting console for debugging purposes.

Starting with @joaomoreno who might know who to send this to, not sure who the real owner is though.

title: Support grunt task argument

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
I'd like to provide my grunt tasks with a single argument but the VSCode task system doesn't support arguments for grunt tasks. I was shocked to discover this because I rarely have grunt tasks without arguments.

I can of course work around this issue by using the "shell" task type to run grunt with arguments.
Here's [that workaround described on StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/a/49361745/576153).
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

title: Issue with launch.json args containing Ampersand character
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30.1
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Have your launch.json file look like this:

```
{
	"version": "0.2.0",
	"configurations": [
		{
			"name": "Debug Main Process",
			"type": "node",
			"request": "launch",
			"cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
			"osx": {
				"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron"
			},
			"windows": {
				"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd"
			},
			"args": [
				"test://update?v=2&id=4&param=16",
				"arg2"
			],
			"program": "${workspaceRoot}/js/app/main/main.js",
			"protocol": "inspector"
		}
	]
}
```

2.  On Windows (there is no issue on Mac), launch the app using VS Code and check the `process.argv` array.  The fourth parameter is "test://update?v=2", which is incorrect.  There is no fifth parameter (but there should be, and the value should be "arg2").  Anything past the first ampersand character is cut off, even the second argument of "arg2".

I've tried to use:

- "test://update?v=2^&id=4^&param=16",
- "\\"test://update?v=2&id=4&param=16\\"",
- "\\"test://update?v=2^&id=4^&param=16\\"",

but I'm unable to get anything to work.  Is there a way to pass command line arguments containing ampersand characters on Windows?

title: Support numeric input variables

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I'd like to be able to use [input variables](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/variables-reference#_settings-command-variables-and-input-variables) to select the port to attach to in my (NodeJS debugging) launch configuration.

```json
        "inputs": [
            {
                "id": "debugPort",
                "description": "Which port do you want to attach to?",
                "default": 9229,
                "type": "pickString",
                "options": [ 9229, 9230, 9239, 9329, 5870 ]
            }
        ]
```

It seems quite likely that substituting a numeric value will be difficult/impossible, so it might be necessary to accept strings for "port" property of launch configurations.

In a perfect world, I'd also be able to alias the ports in the combo box: "default" for 9229, "VS Code Extension" for 5870, etc.

title: Allow to set background color of tab having focus
body:
### It's utterly hard to distinguish the editor having focus from other panels in VS code.

It's always an annoying matter of Try And Error when switching between other software and VS Code (using <kbd>ALT</kbd>+<kbd>TAB</kbd>) and starting to type.

I examined all VS Code color themes that are included with Visual Studio Code, and they all share the same issue:

![vs code tab only](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292193-41f3c280-1a0a-11e9-95fd-db87338e3ab0.png)
![vs code tab only-blue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292577-92b7eb00-1a0b-11e9-8029-7ba925e563c6.png)
![vs code tab only-green](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292580-951a4500-1a0b-11e9-9b6e-958db406b4df.png)
![vs code tab only-red](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292581-96e40880-1a0b-11e9-944c-87d214b577b1.png)

In this example, it's very hard to tell which of the two editors has focus, the left or the right one.

I'm pretty sure y'all won't even recognize the right tab having a vertical squiggly line on the right.

So, I'd like to propose to highlight the editor having focus more vividly, e.g. using the status bar background color as background color for the editor having focus:

### Current Design

![vs code tab current](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292380-c47c8200-1a0a-11e9-8edb-a6409e6989a0.png)

### Desired Design

![vs code tab desired](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292388-c9413600-1a0a-11e9-856e-6886e5d914be.png)
<hr/>

## In Detail:

#### Current Design
![vs code tab only](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292193-41f3c280-1a0a-11e9-95fd-db87338e3ab0.png)

#### Desired Design
![vs code tab only-desired](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/51292728-24bff380-1a0c-11e9-87f4-1df617bc2699.png)

title: Disable Multiple Cursors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I don't use the 'multiple cursors' feature, and there doesn't appear to be any way to turn it off. 

You can change the key binding between ctrl and alt, but there's no way to prevent multiple cursors from being created altogether. If you use these modifiers for other things, it's easy to accidentally create multiple cursors in random places and end up with text in areas you don't expect. 

Being able to set this key binding to 'none' would probably be sufficient.

Fixes #6403

- Populates the inputBox with the default commit message when a merge conflict occurs.

title: Expose a way to get the Extension object for my extension
body:
Until https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15756 is addressed, I am attempting to ship a preview version of the PowerShell extension to the marketplace called "PowerShell Preview". To do so, I have to change the extension ID from `ms-vscode.PowerShell` to `ms-vscode.PowerShell-Preview`.

Unfortunately, there are a few instances where we reach into the package.json for the version and other things via:

```ts
    vscode
            .extensions
            .getExtension("ms-vscode.PowerShell")
            .packageJSON
            .version;
```

If I don't know what my extension ID is (either preview or stable in our case) how can I know the version, name, if I'm preview, etc about my extension from my extension?

title: Previewing an MD file with a .gif image in it crashes the window
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an `.md` file
2. Put in a link to an existing `.gif` image. For example: `![](./test.gif)`
3. Open preview `ctrl + shift + v`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

## UPDATE:
Crash happens when you try to display big images. The limit is somewhere in range between 100mb and 250mb (100mb images do not crash the window)

title: Zero length diagnostic at end of line is rendered over multi-character identifier

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.31.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS 10.14.2 (18C54)

Steps to Reproduce:

- Implement language server and publish diagnostic with zero length at the end of a line
```json
{
        "range": {
          "start": {
            "line": 8,
            "character": 11
          },
          "end": {
            "line": 8,
            "character": 11
          }
        },
        "message": "max value"
      }
```
- The red squiggle renders over the last identifier on the line, which can be multiple characters. On every keystroke, the language server is publshing a new diagnostic where `character` is the last column of that line (== int max value).
![2019-01-14 14 56 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408093/51117043-ed372880-180c-11e9-9069-b8a3caa7d63a.gif)

- I ideally expect the diagnostic to render as a single character as below (there is no space at end of the line). Alternatively, I would expect the zero-length diagnostic to render at most overÂ one character at the end of the line and not the full identifier.
![screenshot 2019-01-14 at 14 48 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408093/51117102-15268c00-180d-11e9-8854-94f9ab377c16.png)

Possibly related comment https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24711#issuecomment-304665290

> Errors and Warnings now get artificially inflated such that they are visible even in the collapsed case.


Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes, I can reproduce with latest Insider but I had to install one extension for my language server to publish diagnostics https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=scalameta.metals

title: Shrink empty lines
body:
Visual Studio has a nice extension called "**Shrink Empty Lines**" which enables the user to have empty lines and/or lines without alphanumeric characters shrunk in the editor to a specific extent. This way users can have more vertical space for their actual code.

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=VisualStudioPlatformTeam.SyntacticLineCompression

It would be very nice to have this feature on VS Code, maybe with an extra setting to specify shrinking percentage (or just an enumeration). I would have made an extension but this is clearly something not achievable through the current Extension API.

title: Invalid path for multi-root workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Bug ![2019-01-13_14-14-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11512/51084626-1fc62000-173e-11e9-90ae-de800aa1efd6.png) Output panel contains a valid path: ``` /Users/aleksi/Code/My/vscode-bug-multiroot/project-2/project2.go ``` When âŒ˜+clicked, it tries to use an invalid path: ``` file:///Users/aleksi/Code/My/vscode-bug-multiroot/project/-2/project2.go ``` Note the extra `/` before `-2`. That seems to happen only with multi-root workspace when one root path is a prefix of another root path. Example repo: https://github.com/AlekSi/vscode-bug-multiroot Steps to reproduce: 1. `git clone https://github.com/AlekSi/vscode-bug-multiroot.git` 2. `code vscode-bug-multiroot/bug.code-workspace` 3. Install Go plugin (but that issue is not specific for it). 4. Open project2_test.go, click CodeLens' "run test". 5. `go test` runs `go vet` and notices a bug in project2.go. âŒ˜+click on the file path in the Output panel. VS Code version: Code 1.30.2 (61122f88f0bf01e2ac16bdb9e1bc4571755f5bd8, 2019-01-07T22:48:31.260Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.2.0
